speaker: LUCY
text_entry: SCENE IV. Other plains in Gascony.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Enter SOMERSET, with his army; a Captain of TALBOT's with him

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: It is too late; I cannot send them now:

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: This expedition was by York and Talbot

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Too rashly plotted: all our general force

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Might with a sally of the very town

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Be buckled with: the over-daring Talbot

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Hath sullied all his gloss of former honour

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: By this unheedful, desperate, wild adventure:

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: York set him on to fight and die in shame,

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: That, Talbot dead, great York might bear the name.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Here is Sir William Lucy, who with me

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Set from our o'ermatch'd forces forth for aid.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Enter Sir William LUCY

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: How now, Sir William! whither were you sent?

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Whither, my lord? from bought and sold Lord Talbot;

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Who, ring'd about with bold adversity,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Cries out for noble York and Somerset,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: To beat assailing death from his weak legions:

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: And whiles the honourable captain there

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Drops bloody sweat from his war-wearied limbs,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: And, in advantage lingering, looks for rescue,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: You, his false hopes, the trust of England's honour,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Keep off aloof with worthless emulation.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Let not your private discord keep away

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: The levied succors that should lend him aid,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: While he, renowned noble gentleman,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Yields up his life unto a world of odds:

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Orleans the Bastard, Charles, Burgundy,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Alencon, Reignier, compass him about,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: And Talbot perisheth by your default.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: York set him on; York should have sent him aid.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: And York as fast upon your grace exclaims;

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Swearing that you withhold his levied host,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Collected for this expedition.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: York lies; he might have sent and had the horse;

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: I owe him little duty, and less love;

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: And take foul scorn to fawn on him by sending.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: The fraud of England, not the force of France,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Hath now entrapp'd the noble-minded Talbot:

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Never to England shall he bear his life;

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: But dies, betray'd to fortune by your strife.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Come, go; I will dispatch the horsemen straight:

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Within six hours they will be at his aid.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Too late comes rescue: he is ta'en or slain;

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: For fly he could not, if he would have fled;

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: And fly would Talbot never, though he might.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: If he be dead, brave Talbot, then adieu!

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: His fame lives in the world, his shame in you.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Exeunt
